Area''', as defined by the [[United States Census Bureau]], is an area consisting of two counties, [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit]] and [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage]], in northeastern [[Ohio]] and is anchored by the city of [[Akron, Ohio|Akron]]. As of the [[United States Census, 2010|2010 census]], the MSA had a population of 703,200. The Akron Metropolitan Statistical Area is also part of the larger [[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]]–Akron–[[Elyria, Ohio|Elyria]] [[Greater Cleveland|Combined Statistical Area]] with a population of 2,891,988 and is the largest [[Ohio census statistical areas|metropolitan area in Ohio]]. The racial makeup of the MSA was 84.8% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 11.9% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.20% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1.8% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 0.26% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.34% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 1.2% of the population. 3.4% of the population were reported as foreign born and 5.4% reported speaking a language other than English as the primary language in the home. In the MSA the population was spread out with 18.7% the age of 14 or under, 14.4% from 15 to 24, 25.7% from 25 to 44, 27.6% from 45 to 64, and 13.5% who were 65 years of age or older. For every 100 females there were 94.1 males. The median family income in 2007 dollars in the MSA was $61,537 and the median household income in the MSA was $47,336. Males had a median income of $38,776 versus $26,532 for females. == Parks & Recreation == === National Parks === ==== Cuyahoga Valley National Park ==== [[Cuyahoga Valley National Park]]{{cite web|url=http://www.nps.gov/cuva/index.htm/ |title=http://www.nps.gov/cuva/index.htm |publisher=http://www.nps.gov/cuva/index.htm |date= |accessdate=2011-13-11}} is a national park located in [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit County]] and lies between the major [[Ohio]] cities of [[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]] and [[Akron, Ohio|Akron]]. It is the only national park located in [[Ohio]] and consists of over 33,000 acres. Waterfalls, rolling hills, caves, winding river scenery attract many park visitors. Over 125 miles of trails traverse the steep narrow ravines, rolling floodplain, and lush farmland throughout the park. The park offers an array of preserved and restored displays of 19th (see [[Hale Farm & Village]]) and early 20th century sustainable farming and pastoral, rural living, while catering to contemporary interests with art exhibits, outdoor concerts, and scenic excursion and special event railroad tours on the [[Cuyahoga Valley Scenic Railroad]]{{cite web|url=http://www.cvsr.com/ |title=http://www.cvsr.com/ |publisher=http://www.cvsr.com/ |date= |accessdate=2011-13-11}}. === County Wide Park Districts === ==== Metro Parks, Serving Summit County ==== The [[Metro Parks, Serving Summit County]]{{cite web|url=www.summitmetroparks.org/ |title=www.summitmetroparks.org|publisher=www.summitmetroparks.org |date= |accessdate=2011-13-11}} is a park district that manages over 11,000 acres in [[Summit County]], including 14 developed parks, six conservation areas and more than 125 miles of trails including the 33.5 mile Hike and Bike Trail which follows the course of the old [[Akron, Bedford and Cleveland Railroad]]. The Freedom Trail is currently being constructed and is similar to the Hike and Bike Trail. It will follow a former rail corridor west from [[Ravenna, Ohio|Ravenna]] through [[Kent, Ohio|Kent]] in [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage County]] and hookup with the Towpath Trail and the Hike and Bike Trail in [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit County]]. ==== The Ohio and Erie Canal Towpath Trail ==== The Ohio and Erie Canal Towpath Trail{{cite web|url=http://www.ohioanderiecanalway.com/Main/Home.aspx/ |title=http://www.ohioanderiecanalway.com/Main/Home.aspx |publisher=http://www.ohioanderiecanalway.com/Main/Home.aspx |date= |accessdate=2011-13-11}} in [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit County]] follows the course of the former [[Ohio and Erie Canal]]. When the trail is fully complete, it will stretch about 100 miles from [[Downtown Cleveland]] in [[Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Cuyahoga County]], though the [[Cuyahoga Valley National Park]] and [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit County]], [[Stark County, Ohio|Stark County]] and end in [[New Philadelphia, Ohio|New Philadelphia]] in [[Tuscarawas County, Ohio|Tuscarawas County]]. In 2011, [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit County]] became the first of the counties to complete their section of the Towpath Trail stretching 33.4 miles from the Portage Lakes in the southern portion of the county, through the suburbs and downtown [[Akron, Ohio|Akron]], and finally through the [[Cuyahoga Valley National Park]]. ==== Portage Park District ==== The Portage Park District{{cite web|url=http://www.portageparkdistrict.org/ |title=http://www.portageparkdistrict.org/|publisher=www.summitmetroparks.http://www.portageparkdistrict.org/|date= |accessdate=2011-13-11}} is a county park district in [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage County]] that consists of 1150 acres. Notable trails include the Headwater Trail which follows the former Cleveland-Mahoning Railroad line and connects [[Mantua, Ohio|Mantua]] and [[Garrettsville, Ohio|Garrettsville]]. The Freedom Trail/Portage Hike and Bike Trail is currently being constructed and will connect with existing trails in [[Summit County, Ohio|Summit County]]. === State Parks and Nature Reserves === ==== Nelson Kennedy Ledges State Park ==== [[Nelson Kennedy Ledges State Park]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/nelsonk/tabid/775/Default.aspx/ |title=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/nelsonk/tabid/775/Default.aspx |publisher=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/nelsonk/tabid/775/Default.aspx |accessdate=2011-11-13}} is a 167 acre state park located near [[Garrettsville, Ohio|Garrettsville]] in [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage County]]. The spectacular rock formations at Nelson-Kennedy Ledges have become trademarks of the park. These rock formations are among the few outcrops in northern Ohio still exposed to view and offer hiking trails ranging from easy to difficult. Activities located in the park include hiking and picnicking. ==== Portage Lakes State Park ==== [[Portage Lakes State Park]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/portage/tabid/779/Default.aspx/ |title=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/portage/tabid/779/Default.aspx|publisher=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/portage/tabid/779/Default.aspx|accessdate=2011-11-13}} is a 2,475 acre state park located in [[Akron, Ohio|Akron]] around the [[Portage Lakes (Ohio)|Portage Lakes]]. There are approximately 2034 acres of water and 8 lakes within the park that can be used for boating, fishing, and swimming and an additional 411 acres of land that can be be used for camping, hunting, and picnicking. ==== Tinker's Creek State Park ==== [[Tinkers Creek State Park]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/tinkers/tabid/793/Default.aspx/ |title=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/tinkers/tabid/793/Default.aspx |publisher=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/tinkers/tabid/793/Default.aspx |accessdate=2011-11-13}} is a 370 acre state park located in [[Streetsboro, Ohio|Streetsboro]] in [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage County]]. Park activities include fishing on a 15 acre spring-fed lake, picnicking, hiking, and cross country skiing and ice fishing during winter. ==== West Branch State Park ==== [[West Branch State Park]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/westbrnch/tabid/795/Default.aspx/ |title=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/westbrnch/tabid/795/Default.aspx |publisher=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/westbrnch/tabid/795/Default.aspx |date= |accessdate=2011-11-13}} is a 8,002 acre state park located near [[Ravenna, Ohio|Ravenna]] in [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage County]]. The large 2,650-acre lake can be used for boating, fishing, and swimming and contains numerous boat launches. The 5,379-acres of meadows and woodlots can be used for numerous activities such as for camping, hiking, hunting and horseback riding. The park maintains 14 miles of hiking trails, 12 miles of mountain biking trails, and 20 miles of bridle trails. ==== Wingfoot Lake State Park ==== Wingfoot Lake State Park{{cite web|url=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/wingfoot/tabid/22946/Default.aspx/ |title=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/wingfoot/tabid/22946/Default.aspx |publisher=http://www.dnr.state.oh.us/parks/parks/wingfoot/tabid/22946/Default.aspx |date= |accessdate=2011-13-11}} is a 690 acre state park located in [[Mogadore, Ohio|Mogadore]] in [[Portage County, Ohio|Portage County]] around Wingfoot Lake. The park was built in the 1960s by the [[Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company]] for their employees and corporate retreats. In 2009, the park was bought by the Ohio Department of Natural Resources, Division of Wildlife. Facilities include enclosed and open pavilion shelters (some with fireplaces), playgrounds, badminton courts, horseshoe pits, bocce ball courts, an 18-hole mini-golf course, and a 18-hole disc golf course.
